newsitem.title: USA: OEA sinks on poor profits.
newsitem.headline: OEA sinks on poor profits.

text.p: OEA Inc shares slumped over six percent on Wednesday after the maker of airbag products posted disappointing fourth quarter and year earnings.
The shares were off 2-4/8, or over six percent, to 39-3/8 in early afternoon trading.
OEA's chairman and chief executive Ahmed Kafadar said in the release the earnings for both the quarter and the year were "lower than anticipated".
OEA earned $0.33 a share in the fourth quarter, compared to $0.38 a share in the year-ago period.
For the year, OEA earned $1.25 a share compared to $1.15 last year before a non-recurring charge of $0.11 a share.
OEA also said in order to account conservatively, it did not include $3.2 million of revenue which is in dispute with Morton International Inc.
The revenue in question would have added $0.10 per share to the fourth quarter, it said. OEA said it expects the issue to be resolved successfully.
